title: Workshop on Anthropometric Data Analysis
text: First workshop is scheduled on 7 September 2022.

title: About
text:
Department of Community & Family Medicine
Department has been pivotal in imparting research methodology, epidemiology and biostatistics trainings. It has a set up a computer laboratory and conducted workshops for faculty and SRs of the institute. Faculty of the department has expertise in advanced data analysis particularly in the fields of nutritional data. Department also provides technical support to nutrition related public health programs in the state of Madhya Pradesh through CSAM wing of Regional Centre of Excellence for Nutritional Rehabilitation, Resource & Training.

title: Resources
text:
Other Useful Tools
Canadian Pediatric Endocrine Group - Shiny Apps for Anthropometric Calculations

who2007: a Shiny app for children ages 5–19 years, based on the WHO growth reference
Growth chart plotter for WHO (for children 2–19 years) and US CDC (2–20 years)
Growth chart plotter for WHO for children 0–2 years
How to create csv files and calculate age in months in excel?



Growth Standards

WHO Growth Standards for 0-5 year Children
WHO Growth References for 5-19 years
Indian Academy of Pediatrics Growth Charts (0-18 years)



Additional interesting readings

WHO Technical Report : Physical status : the use of and interpretation of anthropometry, report of a WHO expert committee
The LMS method for constructing normalized growth standards(Cole 1990)
Revised IAP Growth Reference(Khadilkar et al. 2015)
Methods- WHO Growth Standards (0-5 years)(Borghi et al. 2006)
Methods-WHO school age and adolescent growth reference development(Onis et al. 2007)






References

Borghi, E., M. de Onis, C. Garza, J. Van den Broeck, E. A. Frongillo, L. Grummer-Strawn, S. Van Buuren, et al. 2006. “Construction of the World Health Organization Child Growth Standards: Selection of Methods for Attained Growth Curves.” Statistics in Medicine 25 (2): 247–65. https://doi.org/10.1002/sim.2227.


Cole, T. J. 1990. “The LMS method for constructing normalized growth standards.” European Journal of Clinical Nutrition 44 (1): 45–60.


Khadilkar, Vaman, Sangeeta Yadav, K. K. Agrawal, Suchit Tamboli, Monidipa Banerjee, Alice Cherian, Jagdish P. Goyal, et al. 2015. “Revised IAP Growth Charts for Height, Weight and Body Mass Index for 5- to 18-Year-Old Indian Children.” Indian Pediatrics 52 (1): 47–55. https://doi.org/10.1007/s13312-015-0566-5.


Onis, Mercedes de, Adelheid W Onyango, Elaine Borghi, Amani Siyam, Chizuru Nishida, and Jonathan Siekmann. 2007. “Development of a WHO Growth Reference for School-Aged Children and Adolescents.” Bulletin of the World Health Organization 85 (9): 660–67. https://doi.org/10.2471/BLT.07.043497.
